channel.title: Help
channel.description: EDIT: I am not using Motivote since someone told me to use it because its "better" and it works perfectly and runs perfectly, and doesnt crash me whatsoever. But the only problem i am having is... When you click vote say moparscape, and you vote, then go back to the vote page, it still says you need some # of votes, and wont go down... why is this?

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Soull3sss1, post:6, topic:550290”]I got it all reset, instead of using GTLVote i changed to motivote because i got told to, so i switched, and everything works, just when someone votes on website, it doesnt show the count go down, still says he has to vote on all 3 sites even if i already did,

EDIT: There are no errors, or anything server sided. or any i know except what i just said website sided

EDIT: Yes i have Remote MYsql setup. and it works serversided[/quote]
So how is it better if it doesn’t work? I’m just saying.

Note: Moparscape does not have callback support. So any verification process for moparscape will not work, whatsoever.

Also, most of your issue is website sided. Not server. As I’m not a website developer, I can’t help much.

Most I could say is to check your callback urls, and to check the MySQL database to see if it’s recording the votes.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Soull3sss1 Soull3sss1
item.description:
@Soull3sss1 wrote:

I got it all reset, instead of using GTLVote i changed to motivote because i got told to, so i switched, and everything works, just when someone votes on website, it doesnt show the count go down, still says he has to vote on all 3 sites even if i already did,

EDIT: There are no errors, or anything server sided. or any i know except what i just said website sided

EDIT: Yes i have Remote MYsql setup. and it works serversided

Read full topic
